name: Amber Walker
text: They close at one time then another and always stop taking orders 15 minutes before they close! So they don't reflect that anywhere in their signage. Makes it hard to give higher rating. The employees are always genuinely friendly and polite.

name: Robert Whitley
text: This location is closed. Closed down when the Kmart at this location went out of business.. Uhaul owns the building now.

name: Steve Feist
text: Today is sadly our last day of operations. We would like to sincerely thank our loyal clientele. It has been our privilege to serve you!

name: Gabriela Gamero
text: I was there two days ago but it was completely close, there no business in that place and I'm so going to miss Little Caesar's and Kmart. It was great place to shop and eat there goodbye üò≠

name: REZIVOR since93
text: A great Little Caesars location. I am REALLY hoping that the Little Caesars in Kmart can remain open when U-Haul moves to the Kmart building. Or atleast remain open, moving into a vacant building in the same area. They have great tasting pizza & breadsticks. Friendly service etc..

name: Meagan Hoffert
text: I‚Äôm not expecting a lot considering the pizza is cheap, but my husband and I have been to a few Little Caesar‚Äôs in our time. This one, the one in KMart, is not exactly the best. Their sign, yes in store, says that they are open until 8pm ‚Ä¶More

name: Donald Iarussi MFA
text: I think their Pizza is way better than 90% of the place is that advertised on television or advertise to the hipsters that they have great pizza when actually they don't it's sad when you can actually say that a $5 Pizza is better than 90% of the pizza places in town

name: DRAL509
text: Pizza is always hot and fresh.   People are nice.  Never seems to be open till 8 though.  Seems they close at 7 most nights.

name: LA CA
text: Went there the other day and they are no longer open due to Kmart closing . Kmart is still having their close out sale though. This location was the better of the little Cesar's in the area sad to see it's closed and empty.

name: Alyssa Rudzinis
text: Quite a long wait for 2 " hot n ready's "... There were no available staff when we first arrived . Had to wait a while for someone to even show up to the front to order. When we got the pizza there was WAAY too much sauce towards the crust and none over the rest of the üçï

name: Joshua Williams
text: Awesome pizza tried the thin crust I was impressed will definitely be going back there

name: northwolf02
text: Good value for money. Better than Wal-Mart pizza

name: Alicia Kelley
text: Good pizza! Sad to see they are closing. We eat lunch their often.

name: John Sandoval
text: Call it nostalgia but I grew up with little ceasars, so I'm a bit biased. If you really need a good review for a pizza joint franchise then you really need to get out more.

name: Cassi Sellers
text: Good pizza great price way to busy!! Needs more room for waiting

name: Mike Miller
text: They have great pizza. If you don‚Äôt know this it‚Äôs own by Kmart and by the owner that owns all the others around town. They‚Äôre pizza here taste much better than the others in my opinion... try it order what younirmsl get from the others and ‚Ä¶More

name: April Evans
text: Great place to stop if your in a time crunch & need to feed your family. The bread sticks are the best .

name: John Johnston
text: Well, unfortunately this one is going the way of the dodo due to the closure of Kmart. Great Little Ceasar's, much better than the other ones.

name: Monica Justice
text: I just came here for an extra most bestest pepperoni pizza.. just came out of the oven no wait. All the other little caesars I‚Äôve been to in town I‚Äôve had to wait twenty plus minutes. The ladies were super nice also I will be back.

name: Rod Holdal
text: This is the last straw, pizza was burnt,crust looked like it blew up.i even took pics Incase anybody ask me about this location. Breadsticks were dry and I had to ask if I could get some sauce. I shouldn‚Äôt have to take it back since it‚Äôs not like it‚Äôs right around the corner

name: jason hicks
text: Waited in line for about 20 minutes before anyone even acknowledged me, the whole time watching all the workers making pizzas with no gloves. This is absolutely disgusting and this place needs to be shut down by the health department. Wish i could give less than 1 star.

name: Ya lGirL
text: I don't know how people can give this place such a bad rating! I drive out of my way to get to this location.  I live on the south hill and that little caesars is the worst! Its always over cooked and the people are rude.  This one is the best in Spokane

name: Ada LaClaire
text: Always love this place. I am very sad they are closing.

name: Robert Jones
text: One of two local known that still has the 5 dollar hot and ready. Promise of hot is correct, but they are never ready. 6 minute wait isnt bad though. A huge down side is that they close at 7, 6 on Sundays - which is dinner time for many

name: carl hamilton
text: Hot and ready is never ready

name: Dusty Silva
text: Quick easy and were good with customer service. But, the pizza was a little lacking. This may have been due to us coming in late and ordering 4 pizzas but, it was a bit stale.

name: Scott Webb
text: Best friggen Little Caeser's in town. I love the cheese bread, which they slather with garlic butter so you have to soak it up with napkins. Not stingy at all. Damn delicious.

name: Jason Stewart
text: No pizzas ready and getting answers on when I could get one was like pulling teeth. The workers looked at me as if I was  bothering them... they were not busy just 3 people running around with no clue what was going on....

name: Mathew Henry
text: Sign says hot and ready....never i ever come in here and had a pizza ready. Its not busy. Workers are standing around. And no pizzas. Idk how the company can use a " hot and ready" slogan when theres never any pizza ready!

name: Bethany Eby
text: Really i wouldn't give this location a single star for a rating considering i was unable to eat anything from their store tonight. Having a two week old baby, my husband and i often have to eat later than usual and take relief in an ‚Ä¶More

name: Brandon Eichenlaub
text: Horrible. The place was filthy. The tables had not been wiped off in sometime. And the employees moved remarkably slow. I love little ceasers. But I will not eat at this location again.

name: Taylor Sakurai
text: The pizza is the best and I can feed the whole family for ten bucks

name: Morgan Pipkin
text: The pizza didn't look like pizza.. It tasted decent though.

name: Rae Presnell
text: Best little Caesar ever...will be missed

name: Dappy
text: Never a problem with the food here

name: AM PN Marie
text: dunno what Brandon Eichenlaub is referring too yeah at times the tables do appear dirty but upon closer inspection you realize the table is stained with iceee i asked the manager about it and he said it only takes about two seconds for an ‚Ä¶More

name: David Wilson
text: They used to stay open till 7pm now they close at 5pm and I usually go there to pick up dinner but when I don't get.off work till 5pm and they didn't have any signs up telling anyone about their new hours

name: Dave Thomas
text: They changed their hours and didn't update them online

name: Shawn Green
text: Very rude terrible customer service, was ignored and got a snide attitude from both employees working, all I wanted was bread sticks, not even worth the minimum wage they make, time to hire better "smarter people who have customer service skills

text: Little Caesar's is gone, Kmart is closing their doors. üò´
